availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Cox (Hopkins Co., KY, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Missouri native. Son of Bershaba Cox. Married to Wealthy Ann Cox. Father of Meredith Cox, Watt N. Cox, and Agnes W. Cox. Resident of Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 166B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 635.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 211B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 2, p. 37B.
"William Thomas Cox (1835-1868)," Find A Grave, Memorial #66910902, accessed November 3, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66910902.
